IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT

The City of Zeigler Water Department informed us this afternoon of a water line break that impacts service provided to Zeigler-Royalton CUSD 188. City workers worked into this evening to repair it, but a short time ago we were informed that, in order to finish the repair, there will be a disruption to our water service beginning tomorrow morning that could last for a good portion of the school day. This disruption in service impacts many of our facilities, including the use of restrooms and other services necessary to function throughout the day. As a result, the district is forced to implement a Remote Learning day for all students tomorrow (Wednesday, September 9, 2020).

Assuming the water line is repaired tomorrow, In-Person Learning will resume on Thursday, September 10, 2020. Thursday will once again be a "B-Day" for our 5th-12th grade students.

Breakfast and lunch delivery will begin at approximately 9:15 AM tomorrow.

- Mediacom offers internet service in your community or area

- You have at least one student in grades K-12 living at home

- At least one child qualifies for free or reduced-price school lunch through the National School Lunch Program (NSLP)

-You are not a current Mediacom internet customer and have NOT subscribed to our internet service in the past 90 days

-You do not have an outstanding Mediacom bill or unreturned equipment

post_text: The Creative Writing class wrapped up National Novel Writing Month (NaNoWriMo) in November. Help us in congratulating each of them.
